sections.MISSION:
1st Squadron, 2d Cavalry Regiment conducts M4/M249 Qualifications on 29-30MAY25 at RG 202A to qualify and maintain proficiency on the M4/M249.
M4/M249 QUALIFICATION: RNG 114 (29-30MAY25)
N
COMMANDERS
sections.PURPOSE: of this range is to provide Soldiers an opportunity to conduct a zero and qualification on the M4 and M249, while ensuring unit readiness and preparation for future operations.​
sections.END STATE:
Soldiers conduct refresher training on their primary weapon system and successfully qualify on Table VI.
TRAINING OBJECTIVES:
1.) Conduct M4/M249 PMI
2.) Conduct Zero and M4/M249 Table V
3.) Conduct M4/M249 Table VI
4.) Retrain and Refire as Needed
5.) Every Attending Soldier Qualifies

Range will cease fire if a fire erupts on the training range and will not go wet until all fire has been cleared from the range.
Any Solider that spots a fire will call the range to cease fire.
In the case of fire, range control will be called when prompted by the range meister to keep them abreast of the situation.
Fire fighting detail will remain ready will all PPE in the case that they must be deployed to retard fire.

subtasks.hazard: Slips, trips, falls & other misc. injuries

values: Soldiers will execute Qualification in Full Dragoon Standard.
Soldiers climbing on top of tactical vehicles wear a helmet and maintain 3-points of contact.
No unharnessed Soldiers when vehicles are moving.
OIC/RSO understands and has briefed MEDEVAC plan on the real world casualty evacuation plan.
A designated vehicle will be marked properly for CASEVAC/MEDEVAC at the range tower.
Driver and Medic/CLS certified person will be briefed on routes, and strip maps with coordinates of AXP stored in vehicle.
Medic will carry medic certification paperwork at all times.
Driver and Medic will remain with MEDEVAC Vehicle at all times.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall risk to be low as a result of an unlikely probability of a critical event; I assess the overall residual risk to be low due to critical severity of unlikely probability.Most Dangerous Risk: FratricideMitigation: Emplacement of range safeties, execution of proper PMI, and wearing Dragoon Standard PPE.Most Likely Risk: Negligent dischargeMitigation: Disciplined PMI prior to range execution, safeties ensure proper usage of M320 during TBLVI, RSO clears Soldiers at the clearing point.
